intro: Sphenomeris chinensis, commonly known as the Chinese sphenomeris, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Polygonaceae. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, clustered leaves that are typically green and lanceolate in shape. The plant produces tiny, greenish flowers that are borne in dense inflorescences, often appearing in late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is native to regions of East Asia, including China and Korea. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
